titlestmt.subtitle: An Inventory of John William Wolf at the Veterans History Project
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Evelyn B. Green, Archivist, CCSU Veterans History Project

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2010-06-07T15:21-0400

did.physloc: Center for Public Policy and Social Research (CPPSR) 207 DiLoreto Hall, Central Connecticut State University (CCSU) 1615 Stanley St. New Britain, CT 06050

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: A native of Forestville, Connecticut John Wolf served as Master Sergeant during World War II and the Vietnam Conflict. He was drafted into the United States Air Force in 1943 serving overseas in Hawaii and China. During World War II John served as an Air Craft Maintenance Technician eventually becoming Assistant Line Chief. John continued his work as an Air Craft Maintenance Technician in Cam Ranh Bay during the Vietnam Conflict. He also served as Flight Chief, and Line Chief in Vietnam. For his dedication and service to the United States military John received the Asiatic Pacific Campaign Medal, the Air force Good Conduct Medal, the National Defense Service Medal, and the Air Force Commendation Medal for Meritorious Service. He was honorably discharged in October of 1967.

scopecontent.head: Scope Note
scopecontent.p: This collection details John Wolf’s training and military experiences during World War II as well as his enlistment experiences in the Vietnam Conflict. A taped interview was conducted on February 11, 2004 at Central Connecticut State University by Eileen Hurst. Along with the interview the collection contains reproductions of scanned service records, and an interview synopsis. The materials cover John Wolf’s experiences from 1943 thru 1967, providing evidence of U.S. military air craft training, maintenance, and aviation development during both military engagements

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: For permission to publish please contact Central Connecticut State University’s Center for Public Policy and Social Research at (860) 832-2976.

custodhist.head: Custodial History note
custodhist.p: All manuscripts and photographs donated were digitized and digitally preserved. The donor retained all original manuscripts and photographs.

altformavail.head: Online Access
altformavail.p: An online exhibition of this veteran's papers can be accessed at project's website

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: "John W. Wolf Papers.VHP2004/7." Veterans History Project; Central Connecticut State University, Center for Public Policy and Social Research

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged based on content and material type into 3 series:
